meanings.definition: One who pretends to be someone or something they are not.
meanings.sent1: The faker claimed to be a famous actor, but everyone knew he was lying.
meanings.sent2: The detective uncovered the identity of the faker who had been posing as a doctor.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched their friend play the role of a faker magician at the party.
meanings.sent4: The faker's disguise was so convincing that even his closest friends didn't recognize him.
meanings.sent5: The community was shocked to discover that their trusted leader was actually a faker with a hidden past.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in deception or fraud.
meanings.sent1: The faker tricked many people into investing in a fake business scheme.
meanings.sent2: The police arrested the notorious faker who had been forging documents for years.
meanings.sent3: The faker's elaborate scam was finally exposed when his lies started unraveling.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was a master faker, able to deceive even the most cautious individuals.
meanings.sent5: The community banded together to protect themselves from falling victim to the faker's schemes.

meanings.definition: To pretend to feel or have a particular emotion.
meanings.sent1: She tried to faker happiness at the party, but her friends could see through her facade.
meanings.sent2: He didn't want to faker interest in the boring conversation, so he excused himself politely.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to faker sadness during his performance for a comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: In order to fit in, he had to learn how to faker enthusiasm for activities he didn't enjoy.
meanings.sent5: The actress had to faker fear during the intense scene, even though she wasn't actually scared.
